channel.title: Need to get compiler working

item.title: Need to get compiler working
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“volsfan18, post:5, topic:407532”][quote author=SacredHeart link=topic=508814.msg3691375#msg3691375 date=1312150069]
1.) Your a first time poster.
2.) It’s probably a leeched source and you can’t code.
3.) If you can’t make a compiler work then stop coding.

32-Bit Compiler:

@echo off title (Your server name) java -cp *.java pause
[/quote]
The 32-Bit Compiler seemed to work, so thank you for that.

1.) Your probably a somebody on this website, but honestly I don’t give a shit, I’m a someone in real life and am trying to do something new.
2.) I can’t code worth shit, and yes, I did download a source off of the Server Downloads but this is just a place to start my coding and am not going to use this if I ever open up an RSPS. Which I probably don’t have the time to do.
3.) Fuck you, I’m new and have no experience in Java. I’m trying to learn everything as I go along, which is rather hard. You started out in my shoes too.[/quote]

I started out knowing nothing too, I don’t know that much now. I create in Java by using other things as a base. It’s not hard to learn to do basic things in RSPS, I knew how to create a basic leeched server on my second day. Don’t be a smartass to people that are trying to help you, you retarded fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: Need to get compiler working
item.dc:creator: @volsfan18 volsfan18
item.description:
@volsfan18 wrote:

I am trying to get my compiler working and I keep getting “the system cannot find the path specified thing”.

The code I’m using for my compiler is: @echo off
COLOR 02
title Volsfan18
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
And I set up my environmental variables: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Can anyone tell me why my compiler isn’t working, and how to fix it? Sorry, I am very new to this type of stuff.

Read full topic
